info.game_comments: Battle of the Decades: The 1980s game 4.

(1, 1).clue: Home Depot offers more than 50 types of this 3-letter hardwood for solid flooring

(2, 1).clue: They represented Los Angeles when Marcus Allen rushed them to Super Bowl victory in 1984

(4, 1).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents the clue.)  I'm getting out some aggression & not hurting anyone using this form of solo training

(5, 1).clue: Bach was a master on this church instrument, having walked 200 miles to learn its secrets from Dietrich Buxtehude

(6, 1).clue: This "lord of the" British novelists was knighted in 1988

(1, 2).clue: (Alex Trebek presents the clue from the deck of the USS Iowa.) The upper decks of World War II Iowa class battleships were covered in this hard Asian wood, some of it still in place after 70 years; it's the kind of wood you find on expensive yachts

(2, 2).clue: 2014 Baseball Hall of Fame inductee Bobby Cox managed this team to 2,504 wins

(4, 2).clue: Before the electric refrigerator became common, hungry folks would raid this

(5, 2).clue: For a while, Bach had to produce a cantata a week; "I Know that My Redeemer Lives" was for this spring Sunday

(6, 2).clue: This banker brought his son-in-law Samuel Sachs into the business in 1882

(1, 3).clue: The AKC's standard says the color of an Irish Setter should be chestnut red or the reddish brown of this wood

(2, 3).clue: This team began play in 1995 & acquired its first superstar, Vince Carter, in 1998

(4, 3).clue: A format for presenting movies on TV while maintaining the rectangular theatrical image

(5, 3).clue: 20 kids of his own weren't enough--for 27 years Bach supervised boy singers as this "master" in Leipzig

(6, 3).clue: In 2013 this Arizona first baseman led the national league with 125 runs batted in

(1, 4).clue: Thor Heyerdahl's raft Kon-Tiki was made of this extremely lightweight wood

(5, 4).clue: Bach was a master of this art of combining melodic lines, a term also found in an Aldous Huxley title

(1, 5).clue: This tree, Santalum album, has fragrant wood from which an aromatic oil is distilled & used in soaps, candles & incense

(2, 5).clue: The left field fence in their home park is 310 feet from the plate & 37 feet high

(4, 5).clue: Red Smith & Frank Deford are giants of this place

(5, 5).clue: Bach tinkered around & produced sets of "two-part" & "three-part" these for harpsichord

(6, 5).clue: This composer was nominated for 18 Oscars; his only win was for "The Omen"

(1, 1).clue: As a lieutenant of engineers in the late 1830s, he supervised the engineering work for the harbor in St. Louis

(2, 1).clue: A part of the psyche that resides in the unconscious

(1, 2).clue: Known for his scorched earth policy, this union general worked as a banker & lawyer before the war

(2, 2).clue: Olde-time pronoun used nominatively for the second person singular

(3, 2).clue: As you see, he didn't use a scooter to get to court when he was convicted in 2007

(5, 2).clue: Antiwar poet Wilfred Owen was killed in action one week before the end of this war

(6, 2).clue: Used by Native Americans of Washington & Oregon, the Cayuse breed of this has become rare

(1, 3).clue: Later a historical novelist, he presided over the court martial of the Lincoln conspirators

(2, 3).clue: A British interjection, or a genre of skinhead rock

(0, 0).clue: Once a poor British protectorate, in 2012 this peninsular country ranked as the world's richest per capita
